 {{{./PerM Ref.fasta Reads.fasta -v 5 -o out.mapping}}} 
In this example, PerM maps reads.fa to Ref.fasta, allowing five mismatches and output in 
[http://code.google.com/p/perm/wiki/Output .mapping] format. It will check if the index has been saved in the default path. If yes, use the index; if no, build the index, but won't save it in the default path. The seed is chosen by PerM, according to the read length.

 * {{{./PerM RefFilesList.txt ReadsSetFilesList.txt -v 5 -u unmappedReads.fa -E }}} 

 * {{{./PerM Ref.fasta Reads.csfasta -v 5 -m -s my.index --delimiter ',' --seed F3}}} 
 * {{{./PerM my.index SingleEndReads.csfasta -v 5 -o out.sam}}}
